Details: Both agents produced test case outputs focused on DBT testing, but with different scopes and implementation approaches. DBT_Test_Cases provides a comprehensive testing framework with 9 test cases covering general DBT functionality, data validation, and performance testing. SqlServer_to_DBT_Conversion_Tester offers 10 specific test cases targeting SQL Server to DBT conversion validation with individual pytest implementations. The outputs show moderate semantic alignment but significant structural differences in their testing approaches.

Both outputs address DBT testing but with different semantic focuses. DBT_Test_Cases emphasizes comprehensive data validation (total orders, spending calculations, category aggregation) while SqlServer_to_DBT_Conversion_Tester focuses specifically on conversion validation (table references, syntax compatibility, aggregate functions). Both share the common goal of DBT validation but approach it from different angles - general testing vs conversion-specific testing.

Significant structural differences exist. DBT_Test_Cases uses a single comprehensive pytest script with fixtures and multiple test functions in one cohesive structure. SqlServer_to_DBT_Conversion_Tester uses individual test cases with separate pytest scripts for each validation point. The first follows a traditional pytest structure with fixtures and session management, while the second uses standalone test functions with file reading operations.
